p: The influence of essential oil and hydrosol of the species H. perforatum ssp. veronense on the proliferation of cancer cells has been studied. As far as we know, no one has investigated the antiproliferative effect of the hydrosol of this traditional medicinal plant. In the literature, we found only one study on the cytotoxic activity of the aqueous extract of a species of the genus Hypericum, namely H. scabrum, against three cancer cell lines: MCF-7, HCT-116 and LNCaP [ 38]. In contrast to the aqueous extract, the object of our interest was the hydrosol because it contains volatile, water-soluble compounds. Our study showed exceptionally good activity of hydrosol on all three cancer lines tested: Hela (IC 50 = 8.3%), HCT116 (IC 50 = 8.81%) and U2OS (IC 50 = 7.05%) ( Figure 1).
